intro: Cacalia cirsiifolia, commonly known as the slender cowpea or slender thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cacalia cirsiifolia is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
